title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.2: PROVISION OF QUALITY BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Output 2: Capicity of MOET is enhanced to coordinate, plan, implement, and monitor provision of quality basic education with special attention for children with disabilities

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of secondary education teacher training
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 2520/A0/04/802 OUTCOME 6: ACCESS TO IECCD PRIMARY & NFE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2: Capicity of MOET is enhanced to coordinate, plan, implement, and monitor provision of quality basic education with special attention for children with disabilities

description.narrative: UNICEF continues to strengthen the capacity of the MOET on the improvement of the Education Management Information System (EMIS), including the planned implementation of OpenEMIS. A total of 1,411 teachers were trained on child centred learning in this period exceeding the target. The inclusive education policy was approved by cabinet. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/12/2018

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - Availability of an Education Management Information System that transparently feeds findings back to communities or school management committees - score (1-4), see guidance
Service Delivery - Teachers - Primary teachers who received training with funding provided by UNICEF
